intro: Cissus pobeguinii, commonly known as the African rock fig, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Humiriaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by edible fig-like fruits. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing on rocks or in shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as a houseplant or in gardens.
